Posts.Content: Hi sunriser52,  I can’t really answer your question but my consultant surgeon called it a pathology report and the BCN said histology results so I often wondered if they mean the same thing too. Someone will perhaps enlighten us ?  Love Shey xx
Posts.Title: Histology or Pathology ?

Posts.Content: Hi Mazza10, Just wanted to say to you that you are not alone. I am a mental health nurse but I fell into the same dark place as you and couldn’t find anything in my ‘toolkit‘ to help with a diagnosis of breast cancer! Despite support from friends and family I am still struggling. I am also having Herceptin injections every 3 weeks and radiotherapy begins on 6th Dec. I have recently started Tamoxifen and I have noticed my mood is dropping further so making an appointment with my GP to discuss counselling and possibly antidepressants if necessary. I have found that posting on here helps as someone usually comes along with good advice or a virtual hug, particularly on the AWAKE thread which has got me through a few sleepless nights !!  Hugs to you (and Optimistic as I know you are in the same boat xx),  Love Shey xxx
Posts.Title: Mental Health side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Sal, Really missing your piccies at night when I can’t sleep but the priority is for you to look after yourself,    we will still be here after your period of self healing. Much love and hugs on your journey, Love Shey xxxx
Posts.Title: London Lass

Posts.Content: Hiya Gill,  Welcome aboard the good ship ’Rads’ - sailing into Christmas ! ;) Shey xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Cheers ladies,
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Good grief - I did type Mazza 10 lol. Xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi, Had 2 sessions so far with no probs, they were really quick today - the whole process from turning up to leaving took 20 mins! My routine has been as follows - first day no cream beforehand, Aloe gel after and E45 at night. Second day shower and E45 before, Aloe gel after and E45 bedtime. Also drinking lots of water. Good luck with your treatments, love to hear how you’re getting on! Shey xxxxxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi folks,  Today I am half through initial  ‘zaps’ (love that word Plattmom!). No problems so far other a dry mouth and throat but the radiologist said this nothing to do with the treatment. Mmmm - not sure I’m convinced on that one at it started the day after second session. Anyway, drinking lots of water and other fluids. I will have a week’s break after Crimbo then 5 boosts on an all singing and dancing new machine that was recently installed at my unit. Wonder if it makes a cuppa after  - Love Shey x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi - my rads are also starting on Weds 6th so I will check in along the way.  Love Shey.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Ann, LOL - my Sunday name is Sheryl but everyone calls me either Shey or Shez! Shey came from work colleagues as there were 3 of us called Sheryl/Cheryl so we all had a different version of it Cheryl, Chez and me Shey!!  I think starting after Christmas is probably a good idea as my appointments are all over the place due to the break - worried I’ll either forget to turn up or arrive on a day off!! The snow worried me in case I couldn’ Get there as I don’t have a lot of leeway for catchup sessions other than weekends however so far so good.  Love Shey x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Brook 72,  Congratulations, must be a great feeling!! My last whole breast zap is tomorrow - can’t wait as fed up with sitting in traffic, first Christmas shoppers then bargain hunters at the sales. I haven’t experienced any redness, blistering or sore skin but I am very tired and get a sickly, sore, dry mouth and throat after each treatment despite drinking lots of fluid! Plodding on though!  Love Shey x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Brook72, Will do - being so near Christmas is going to be hard due to increased traffic and my hospital is next to a major shopping complex! Oh joy! Shey
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Mazda 10, My Rads start tomorrow. I saw a radiographer prior to treatment to discuss this and she stated no cream etc before as area needs to be clean and dry. She said to try Aloe Vera gel and keep in fridge for afterwards as it is soothing and cooling. I will give it a try and report back! Love Shey xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi,  Two more zaps to go then four days off for Crimbo- thank goodness, driving through the Shopping traffic has been a nightmare so far this week! On the plus side, the hospital car parks are quieter. Still no skin problems and not using E45 cream anymore as my skin seems better without it to be honest - I just put a small blob of Aloe gel on my chest after showering to cool it. Unfortunately, I still have the horrible snotty lurgy which is affecting my chest and making me breathless in the cold air. Also finding it more of an effort to get myself there than before, not sure if that’s due to ‘Rads fatigue’ or monotony.  Anyway, time for my afternoon nap after my enth cuppa today,  Love Shey x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Gill,  of course - we deserve it! Love Shey, champers to follow ;)
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Ann,  Welcome to the Dec Rads club ! The planning session is basically a measuring and photographing session to put it basically, which sets the baseline for treatment- nothing to worry about. My letter said 2 hours but it was all done in an hour. I also had an introduction review with a clinical radiographer first to discuss treatment and ensure I understood what I was having. Also talked about creams, side effects etc. You will be monouvered about on the machine with lots of measurements being discussed and some very small tattoo markers put on your skin (mine are tiny and barely visible!).  Good luck - hope it goes ok and keep in touch Love Shey x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Mazza10, I appear to have also contracted the lurgy, managed to get to my Rads appointment but also had to see my oncologist and I have a tickly cough which wouldn’t stop during the session. I thought she was gonna send me for a chest X-ray! However from the symptoms it appears to be a virus. Also know what you mean about the tablets lol. I’ve have PN and have lost my right thumb nail but it’s the one I use and really miss it, can’t pop the tablets out. To add to the ‘gift’ my MUGA heart scan showed my heart function has decreased by 13% so got to have another and I hate them, they take ages especially having to lie on a hard board. Anyway, soon be Christmas Love Shey x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi,  Over half way now - seems to have gone really quickly. No skin problems yet (touch wood). A word about the marker pen - it takes some bl@@@&y getting off! Despite two showers and a wipe they gave me to remove the dots, dash’s and squiggles, they are still there! So treating myself to a nice soak in the bath this evening to see if that shifts them - I look like I’m covered in graffiti . Have a nice weekend off if your having Rads otherwise have a good weekend!  Love Shey (cough, sniff) x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Lumie,  Sorry you are having to go through this so sending you a big (((HUG)))!  My sister is 45 and she also had similar symptoms to you a couple of weeks ago. After my diagnosis earlier this year she was really worried, especially when she was finally sent for the ultrasound after the mammogram. She also had a lot of pain similar to yours however she was given the all clear and the Dr is writing to her GP to give her opinion of the probable cause - she is seeing GP this week. I was led to believe that the ultrasound is more accurate than the mammogram but I am not 100% sure maybe someone will clarify this. Have they done a biopsy? My sister had one taken at the ultrasound which showed no abnormalities. Fingers crossed it will be the same for you.  This site is really supportive whatever the outcome and especially as it’s sometimes difficult to share your worries with family.  Fingers crossed for you, Love Shey xx
Posts.Title: Recalled, Waiting, Worried

Posts.Content: Hi Mrsox, Sending you hugs and best wishes, hope your wish is granted with minimal fuss! Sorry you’re going through it again and I can well understand why you have made your decision. As a wise person often posts on this site -  Keep smiling ;) Love Shey x
Posts.Title: mrsox

Posts.Content: Hi Sam, I am a worrier too - I have posted my frustrating week regarding a CT scan on the AWAKE thread as it helps to vent. I also tend to overthink things despite reassurance. However, given the amount of chemicals being thrown at your liver and also a spell of illness, logic would suggest it could be struggling hence blood test results - maybe they are being thorough to avoid permanent organ damage as this can happen with chemo if not monitored.  I would trust your BC nurse and look forward to enjoying Christmas!  Love Shey xxx.
Posts.Title: Rang BC nurse about ultrasound

Posts.Content: Hiya Sam, I was originally told I would be having 15 whole breast rads but then it changed to include 5 booster sessions as well. It’s based on the fact that I had a lumpectomy and classed as a ‘younger’ (cough cough) person. The boosts are no different other than they are aimed at the tumour bed and they are quicker. As Optimistic says, your treatment is tailored for you, a lady who was after me had 30 sessions after  her mastectomy but she said these were lower dose to avoid damage to the implant. Hope the treatment goes ok!  Love Shey x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy boosters?

Posts.Content: Hi Deidre,  Yes I am having Herceptin injections every 3 weeks. I also get pains in my arms, hands and shoulders but worse in my elbow area mainly as you say when I first wake up or from sitting. However, I was already going through the menopause and experiencing joint pains. The muscle pain in my legs is a new symptom though! Hi Karen (Toxophilite) - I agree with you about the lack of Oestrogen, my mum had HRT treatment for a long time but really struggled to come off it in her late 60s and ended up going through the menopause again  in her early 70s. Her main problem was joint pain. I’ve decided to give acupuncture a try as the pharmacist at my MacMillan centre says she has had good reports about it from other ladies regarding hot flushes and pain relief for menopause.  Hi Winney,  I had a WLE but after Rads I developed pains in my back which would shoot around under my arm.The radiographer said it was due to the treatment aggrivating nerves where the surgery had been. She said it would gradually improve and it is doing six weeks later.  A mastectomy is a bigger op so I expect it will take longer but I think your BC nurse is a good person to discuss this with. Anyway - roll on July folks  - we can have a virtual celebration when the Herceptin finishes .   Love Shey
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: Hi Optimum,  I am also on Herceptin and finish in July. I get a lot of muscle pain in my legs but put this down to the number of injections I am having - just about to have number 10. I think this is bound to have some effect. I believe the Herceptin is also causing my very dry, sore, crusty (sorry) nose which bleeds easily but my onc doesn’t seem to agree. I didn’t have it before treatment though - I was told this was down to chemo but it has never improved and it finished over 4 months ago. Just come counting down to the injections finishing to see if these symptoms improve. Fingers crossed for us ! Love Shey
Posts.Title: Herceptin and muscle pain

Posts.Content: Hi Guys,  Please be kind to each other. Living with, or after a cancer diagnosis is difficult enough and we look to this site for support. Everyone is an individual and we all deal with things in different ways either by choice, circumstances or both.  Every day, in every way, we are all doing the best we can although it may not appear this way to others from the outside. Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi - the MUGA is really straight forward - you just lie on a bed while your heart is monitored and recorded. It is repeated after 4 months. My result was 70% and I don't know what it means but my onc. registrar said this was probably better than his - I am 52 and he looks about 32!! Anyway, absolutely nothing to worry about and then you can start Herceptin which he also called a "very good drug" at my last appointment.  Shey xx
Posts.Title: ER+ and HER2+

Posts.Content: Hi Emma,  I share your pain! Started Tamoxifen in January and yes I sweat ALL night. Wake up wet through several times a night and now I dread going to bed! Also have flushes right through the day too! My GP prescribed a drug called Clonidine but they don’t seem to be working for me although I’ve seen other people say they’ve had good results. Seeing my Onc on 20th of this month and gonna ask for something else.  Love Shey x
Posts.Title: tamoxifen - hot flushes

Posts.Content: I have been on Tamoxifen now for 5 days. I take them at night - yes they make me feel a bit sick and got mild joint pain. This does not bother me as I have struggled with Fibromyalgia in the past which at one point was severe however at the beginning of the year all my symptoms seemed to disappear- then in May I got breast cancer !!! Anyway, biggest problem is night sweats - or should I say SWEAT, before it was night sweats due to menopause but now just one long drip since day one! Does this get better or should I discuss with someone and if so who with ??  Thank you,  Shey xx
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Hi Folks,  Last night I took my first Tamoxifen and hardly slept. I am 53 and have used to night sweats for 4 years but last night I literally dripped all night! Hope it gets better, prepared for tonight with fan, Summer duvet and sleeping in the buff even though it’s Winter ! Just hope it will get better, Love Shey xx
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone,  I heard about 'chemo brain' and kinda dismissed it as being a bit forgetful at times however today it has really hit me! To summarise, I gave the cat 'cat litter' for breakfast instead of biscuits - don't report me she didn't eat it but it took me 2 hours to realise, I tried to wash the pots with my oven gloves then attemted to put the TV on using my log fire remote control and ended up shouting my son to sort it when it wouldn't work !!! What's happening to me ???? (Lol).  Love Shey xxxx
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain !

Posts.Content: Hi - we sound very similar! I had 24mm grade 3 right side IDC with vas invasion and 2 clear nodes, I also had an area of DCIS and HR and HER 2 pos. I have been given same treatment regime but I opted for a lumpectomy with follow up radiotherapy. I have had first chemo and Herceptin, will also receive 5 years of Anastrazole. I don't think the treatment would be any different in private care from my own research using NICE guidelines. Good luck with your treatment, I'm back for second lot on Thursday.
Posts.Title: HER2 positive and oestrogen receptor positive

Posts.Content: Forgot to mention - my chemo regime is Taxotere, Carboplatin and Herceptin (TCH).
Posts.Title: HER2 positive and oestrogen receptor positive

Posts.Content: Hi Karen (mum and Mia) just want to reassure you, I 'confronted' my oncologist with the query about NICE recommendations on starting chemo within 31 days after surgery and he just shrugged it off by saying that in my case chemo can commence up to 3 months. We are very similar in diagnosis - my op was on 21/06 and chemo on 03/08. My onc is very good - he is a top  chap at my hospital which specialises in cancer treatment only and very active in clinical trials and lecturing so I do trust what he says. Hope this helps, keep in touch. I'm a bit ahead of you so can share my experience. A lady sat next to me at my first chemo was really helpful to me as she'd had 2 sessions and on same drug regime.  Sending hugs xx
Posts.Title: HER2 positive and oestrogen receptor positive
